intro: Helianthocereus escayachensis, commonly known as the Escayachén cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with ribbed stems and produces yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with spines that provide shade and reduce water loss. It blooms during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bats and insects. Its structure and adaptations make it a unique example of desert flora.
